intro: Erigeron novae-zealandiae, commonly known as the New Zealand fleabane, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring and early summer. Erigeron novae-zealandiae is known for its delicate appearance and is often found in native gardens and conservation areas.
